profileText: A Representative from Maryland; born probably on his father's estate near Leonardtown, St. Mary's County, Md. in 1750; pursued an academic course in England; returned to Maryland and engaged in farming; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced; served in the Maryland house of delegates in 1773; member of the committee of correspondence, St. Mary's County, in 1774; again a member of the house of delegates 1779-1790; elected as a Pro-Administration candidate to the Second Congress (March 4, 1791-March 3, 1793); member of the State house of delegates in 1795 and 1796 and served as speaker; died in St. Mary's County, Md., January 4, 1820; interment probably in the churchyard at Chaptico, Md.

researchRecord.name: In the papers of the Carter and Wellford family of Sabine Hall, 1650-1918, ca. 1075 items.
researchRecord.description: Collection contains a letter from Philip Key to Henry Lee, April 20, 1777.

researchRecord.name: In the papers of Alfred J. O'Ferrall, Sr., 1762-1888.
researchRecord.description: Collection contains a letter from Philip Key to W. Blair Portobacco, dated March 11, 1792.
